description:
Low Density Housing - New Building - To construct a 2 storey Net Zero one-family dwelling with a secondary suite located in the Basement/Cellar ($825,500) with an open parking pad, providing 1 parking space, having vehicular access from the 20' Lane.
1. Covenant registered at the Land Title Office under CB873932
2.\tNo Strata Titling permitted
3.\tEntire building to be sprinklered 13D
4.\tAs shown by an asterisk (*) on the building permit floor plans and/or elevations, exit protection is required to be provided in accordance with Articles 9.9.4.4., 9.9.4.6., and/or 9.37.2.8. of the 2019 VBBL.
5.\tExternal mechanical unit – Exterior component located in rear yard, Interior component located in 2nd floor
6.\tBar sink located in recreation room
7.\tSchedule B: (Jeff Allester) P.Eng (604-228-0518) Structural
8.\tSchedule B: (Tegbir Bajwa) P.Eng (778-995-2404) Geotechnical
9.\tHPO: Residential Builder- Insightful Healthy Homes Inc.
Note: This is a 2 storey building pursuant to the Zoning and Development By-Law
Address Information:
Building 1
#1-2852 W 24th Av - Principal Dwelling (1st & 2nd floor, north east and north west portion of bsmt)
#2-2852 W 24th Av - Secondary Suite (south east and south west portion of bsmt)
Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted on the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***
Note: Parking for the site has been provided under DB-2023-01940 (Laneway House)

description:

5.\tHPO: Residential Builder- Horizon One Properties Ltd.
Address Information:
Building 2
#3-135 E 51st Av - Laneway House
Note:
As a result of the addition of a laneway house, the existing single detached house is to be assigned suite number. At permit issuance, the site will be as follows:
#1-135 E 51st Av - Single Detached House
#3-135 E 51st Av - Laneway House
Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted to the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.

NOTE : Main House exterior alteration work to be on a separate building permit (BP-2024-00752).
The issuance of the Main House exterior alteration BP to be completed prior to Framing inspection of the Laneway House.
The Main House exterior alteration work to be completed prior to the Final inspection of the Laneway House.
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

description:

To add, alter, and convert this existing single family dwelling to a multiple conversion dwelling (Building 1) containing 2 dwelling units and, to construct a single family dwelling infill in the rear (Building 2) for a total of 3 dwelling units on this site, providing 3 parking spaces all having vehicular access from the lane.

Related Permits:
DP-2022-00489
BP-2023-02055 - Principal Building

7. All new windows, doors, and skylights shall conform to AAMA/WDMA/CSA101/I.S.2/A440, NAFS.

description: Construction of two six-storey buildings containing 339 rental units, including 271 market rental housing units and 68 moderate-income rental units based on BC Housing's Housing Income Limits (HILs). The development will have a range of unit types from studio to three-bedroom apartments and two to three-bedroom townhouses, with 6 accessible units and 296 Basic Universal Housing (BUH) units. The development will include 698 m2 of indoor amenity space, 3,355 m2 of outdoor amenity space, retention of a central grove of ten maple and oak trees, an on-site low carbon energy plant designed to connect to the future off-site City Centre district energy utility (DEU) system, and five publicly accessible open spaces (mini-pocket parks) totaling 379.7 m2. The proposal also includes a variance to reduce the road setback to projecting balconies above the second floor from 3.0 m to 1.2 m.

rawSummaries.summary:
DP 23-014121
Application by 1166225 BC Ltd. for a Development Permit at 8880 Cook Road and 8751 Citation Drive.

Staff Recommendation:
1. Permit the construction of two six-storey buildings containing 339 rental units at 8880 Cook Road and 8751 Citation Drive on a site zoned "Low Rise Rental Apartment (ZLR44)- Brighouse Village (City Centre)".
2. Vary the provisions of Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500 to reduce the road setback to projecting balconies above the second floor from 3.0 m to 1.2 m.

Key components of the proposal include:
- Approximately 20,107 m2 (216,430 ft2) of purpose-built market rental housing consisting of 271 market rental housing units.
- Approximately 3,755 m2 (40,427 ft2) of purpose-built moderate-income rental housing based on BC Housing's Housing Income Limits (HILs) consisting of 68 moderate-income rental units.
- A range of unit types from studio to three-bedroom apartment units, as well as two to three-bedroom townhouse units.
- Six accessible units and 296 Basic Universal Housing (BUH) units.
- Indoor amenity space of approximately 698 m2 (7,508 ft2) and outdoor amenity space of approximately 3,355 m2 (36,113 ft2).
- Retention of a central grove of ten maple trees and oak trees.
- An on-site low carbon energy plant designed to connect to the future off-site City Centre district energy utility (DEU) system.
- Five publicly accessible open spaces (mini-pocket parks) at strategic locations along the periphery of the development with a total area of 379.7 m2 (4,087 ft2).

description: The application is to rezone the lands from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 2.20 and the building height from 11.5 m to 19.1 m, with an additional height to top of rooftop amenity, to permit the development of a five-storey and four-storey building containing a total of 109 secured market rental units. The site is comprised of three legal parcels on 33rd Avenue with a total area of approximately 2,838 sq. m (30,553 sq. ft.) and a frontage of approximately 42 m (138 ft.). The site contains three single detached homes built between 1910 and 1974.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 1749-1769 East 33rd Avenue
The application is to rezone the lands from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 2.20 and the building height from 11.5 m to 19.1 m, with an additional height to top of rooftop amenity, to permit the development of a five-storey and four-storey building containing a total of 109 secured market rental units. The proposed use and form of development are consistent with the intent of the Secured Rental Policy. The site is in the Kensington-Cedar Cottage neighbourhood and comprised of three legal parcels on 33rd Avenue with a total area of approximately 2,838 sq. m (30,553 sq. ft.) and a frontage of approximately 42 m (138 ft.). The site contains three single detached homes built between 1910 and 1974. The surrounding area is zoned primarily for residential uses under the R1-1 District Schedule, with a CD-1 (564) zoned property to the west. The application is recommended for approval in principle, subject to a Public Hearing and the conditions contained in Appendix B.

description: The report evaluates an application to rezone 255-285 Southwest Marine Drive from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 2.39 and the building height from 11.5 m to 22.0 m, to permit a six-storey residential building with 69 strata units. The site is zoned R1-1 and located on Southwest Marine Drive, consisting of a five-lot assembly with five single-detached homes and seven rental units. The surrounding area is undergoing significant change, with several new buildings in the Marine Gateway area. The Marpole Community Plan anticipates residential apartment buildings up to six-storeys and 2.5 FSR, with potential for additional density. The Vancouver Plan and Housing Needs Report also support the proposed development.

The site is zoned R1-1 and located on Southwest Marine Drive, consisting of a five-lot assembly with five single-detached homes and seven rental units. The Vancouver Plan and Housing Needs Report also support the proposed development. The application by Billard Architecture Inc. on behalf of 1118006 B.C Ltd. is recommended for approval in principle, subject to conditions.

description: The property was rezoned from I-2 (Industrial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. Low Density Housing - New Building - To construct a 1 storey laneway house building ($213,462.50) with an attached garage and 1 open parking pad, providing a total of 3 parking spaces, having vehicular access from the rear 20' Lane.
1. Covenant not required with existing house
2.\tNo Strata Titling permitted
3.\tNo external mechanical unit proposed
4.\tEntire building to be sprinklered 13R
5.\tSchedule B: (Zhi Yi You) P.Eng (778-302-2155) Structural & Geotechnical
6.\tHPO: Jingda Enterprises Ltd
NOTE: To achieve the required FSR. A floor space exclusion of 3% has been applied to this application as per section 11.24.18 of the district schedule, to accommodate improved building performance.
Address Information:
BUILDING 2
#3-1379 Devonshire Cr - Laneway House (1.0 storey)
Note: As a result of the addition of a laneway house, the main house / principal dwelling will be assigned a suite number and the site will be as follows:
#1-1379 Devonshire Cr - Principal Dwelling (retained on site)
#3-1379 Devonshire Cr - Laneway House
Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted on the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.
NOTE: Information regarding the principal building on the survey and site plan is for reference only. Any discrepancy between information regarding the principal building on the survey and/or site plan and approved permit drawings for the principal building are neither approved nor authorized under this laneway house permit.
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

description: Proposed development includes an OCP Amendment from 'Commercial' to 'Multiple Residential' and to Figure 42: Major Employment Areas, an OCP Text Amendment to allow a higher density in the 'Multiple Residential' designation, an NCP Amendment from 'Mixed-Use Commercial/ Residential: Village Node (1.5 FAR)' to 'Mixed-Use Commercial/ Residential: Village Node (2.5 FAR Gross)', a Rezoning from RA to CD, and a Development Permit to permit the development of one 6-storey mixed-use building and one 6-storey residential apartment building, including 1,389 square metres of ground floor commercial and 213 residential units, in West Clayton.

rawSummaries.summary:
7923-0115-00 - 18742 and 18758 - 72 Avenue
Application No. 7923-0115-00 for 18742 and 18758 - 72 Avenue, owned by Square Nine Clayton Development Ltd. with agent Chris Dikeakos Architects Inc. (Richard Bernstein).

Proposed:
- OCP Amendment from "Commercial" to "Multiple Residential" and to Figure 42: Major Employment Areas
- OCP Text Amendment to allow a higher density in the "Multiple Residential" designation
- NCP Amendment from "Mixed-Use Commercial/ Residential: Village Node (1.5 FAR)" to "Mixed-Use Commercial/ Residential: Village Node (2.5 FAR Gross)"
- Rezoning from RA to CD
- Development Permit to permit the development of one 6-storey mixed-use building and one 6-storey residential apartment building, including 1,389 square metres of ground floor commercial and 213 residential units, in West Clayton.

Decision:
- Council approved the amendments and rezoning, and authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7923-0115-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings.

rawSummaries.summary:
Application No. 7918-0398-00, 15853 and 15861 - 16 Avenue
Owner: 1153075 B.C. Ltd. (Directors: H. Khangura, R. Singh, R. Virani)
Agent: Bridgewater Development Corp. (Raghbir Gurm)
Revised Development Permit
Amendment to CD Bylaw No. 20132 to allow for proposed design changes to a previously supported multiple residential development.
Council authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7918-0398-00, rescinded Council Resolution R20-1263 granting Third Reading to 'Surrey Zoning Bylaw, 1993, No. 12000, Amendment Bylaw, 2020, No. 20132' and amended the bylaw to increase the maximum height of principal buildings from 13 metres [43 ft.] to 13.5 metres [44 ft.], and granted Third Reading to the amended bylaw. Council instructed staff to resolve all issues outlined in the original Planning & Development Report for 7918-0398-00 dated July 13, 2020 prior to final adoption.

description:

WEST UNIT

EAST UNIT
#1 - 2891 E Pender St - One Family Dwelling (east portion of 1st - 3rd storey)
#2 - 2891 E Pender St - Secondary Suite (east portion of basement)
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

description:

To construct a 2 storey duplex with 2 secondary suites located in the Basement ($1,641,652.50) with a detached accessory building (garage) at the rear providing 2 parking spaces, having vehicular access from East 54th Ave.

2.\tExternal (20 Heat Pump Mechanical Unit Proposed – Exterior components located in rear yard, Interior components located in Second Floor closets.

5.\tHPO: Residential Builder- (Parkat Singh Lehal And Jaswinder Kaur Lehal)

Address Information:
NORTH UNIT
#1-1260 E 54th Av - One Family Dwelling (1st-2nd floor, basement)
#2-1260 E 54th Av - Secondary Suite (basement)
SOUTH UNIT
#1-7033 Inverness St - One Family Dwelling (1st-2nd floor, basement)
#2-7033 Inverness St - Secondary Suite (basement)
Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted to the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

applicant: Asit Biswas DBA: Maple Building Design Inc.
description:
Low Density Housing - New Building - To construct a 2 storey laneway house building ($275,000) with 1 open parking pad, providing a total of 1 parking spaces, having vehicular access from the rear 20' Lane.
1. Covenant not required with existing house
2.\tNo Strata Titling permitted
3.\tEntire building to be sprinklered 13D
4.\tExternal mechanical unit – Exterior component located in rear yard, Interior component located in 2nd floor closet
5.\tSchedule B: (Wing Ki Leung) P.Eng (604-543-8044) Structural & Geotechnical
6.\tHPO: Golden Pay Trading Inc.
7.\tHRV required for laneway house as of year 2022
Address Information:
Building 2
#3-293 E 59th Av - Laneway House
Note:
As a result of the addition of a laneway house, the existing single detached house is to be assigned a suite number. At permit issuance, the site will be as follows:
#1-293 E 59th Av - Single Detached House (retained on site)
#3-293 E 59th Av - Laneway House
Address and suite numbers assigned as per approved plans for Fire and Emergency response. The address number is to be posted to the building to be visible from the street and the suite numbers are to be posted at the suite entries in accordance with the Building By-law prior to final inspection.
NOTE: Information regarding the principal building on the survey and site plan is for reference only. Any discrepancy between information regarding the principal building on the survey and/or site plan and approved permit drawings for the principal building are neither approved nor authorized under this laneway house permit.
***This permit is issued under the VBBL 2019, with updated energy requirements as per bylaw # 12997 effective Jan 01, 2022.***

17893 - 64 Avenue
To reduce the minimum front (south) yard setback from 7.5 metres to 4.5 metres to the principal building face in order to permit the development of a multi-unit industrial building.

description: Rezoning from RA to RQ and Development Permit to allow subdivision into 2 single family residential lots.

rawSummaries.summary:
7923-0070-00 - 10610 Salisbury Drive
Rezoning from RA to RQ and Development Permit to allow subdivision into 2 single family residential lots.

Owners: S. Bajwa, 1289727 B.C. Ltd. (Directors: A. Bajwa, M. Dhare, Z. Dhare, Z. Dhare), Bismillah Construction Inc. (Directors: A. Bhangu, Z. Khan), Dhannu Homes Ltd. (Director: B. Dhannu), A-1 Ideal Homes Inc. (Directors: A. Bajwa, S. Bajwa, A. Bajwa)
Agent: CitiWest Consulting Ltd. (Jasleen Kaur)

Council endorsed the public notification to proceed for Bylaw No. 21164 to rezone the site from "One-Acre Residential Zone (RA)" to "Quarter Acre Residential Zone (RQ)". Council also authorized staff to draft Development Permit No. 7923-0070-00 for Hazard Lands (Steep Slopes), and Sensitive Ecosystems (Streamside Areas), subject to resolving various engineering, subdivision, tree preservation, ecosystem, geotechnical, and affordable housing requirements.

description: Rezoning of a portion from A-2 to PA-2 to permit the development of a future place of worship.

rawSummaries.summary:
7922-0035-00 - 19054 - 80 Avenue
Rezoning of a portion from A-2 to PA-2 to permit the development of a future place of worship.

Owner: G. Grewal
Agent: G. Grewal

The council approved the following:
1. Introduce a bylaw to rezone the portion of the site from "Intensive Agriculture Zone (A-2)" to "Assembly Hall 2 Zone (PA-2)" and set a date for Public Hearing.
2. Authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7922-0035-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings, Ecosystem Development Plan, and Geotechnical Report.
3. Instruct staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, road dedication, tree preservation, fire protection, ecosystem and geotechnical reports, demolition of existing buildings, public art, and restrictive covenants.

description: Temporary Use Permit to permit the temporary use of the site for truck parking for a period not to exceed 3 years.

rawSummaries.summary:
7923-0175-00 - 10354 - 120 Street
Owner: 12033333 Holdings Ltd. (W. Chen, X. Wei)
Agent: McElhanney Ltd. (Prabhjot Singh Sran)
Temporary Use Permit to permit the temporary use of the site for truck parking for a period not to exceed 3 years.
Council approved the Temporary Use Permit No. 7923-0175-00 to proceed to Public Notification, subject to resolving the following issues prior to final approval:
- Addressing all engineering requirements and issues including restrictive covenants, dedications, and rights-of-way
- Submission of a finalized landscaping, fencing and lighting plan, and landscaping, fencing and lighting cost estimate
- Removal of all structures and tent structures
- Installation and approval of required landscape screening and fencing works along the south of the property
- Submission of financial securities to ensure landscaping and fencing maintenance
- Obtaining permits for the proposed use of the existing mobile office building
- Submission and issuance of a Sensitive Ecosystem Development Permit for the watercourse (Manson Canal) along the northern property line.

description: Rezoning from 'General Agriculture Zone (A-1)' to 'Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)' and Development Permit / Development Variance Permit to allow subdivision into twenty-one single family residential lots.

rawSummaries.summary:
7923-0030-00 - 9331 Bothwell Drive
Rezoning from A-1 to RF-13 and Development Permit / Development Variance Permit to allow subdivision into twenty-one single family residential lots. Key details:
- Owners: R. Chen, J. Chen
- Agent: Hub Engineering Inc. (Mike Kompter)
- Rezoning from "General Agriculture Zone (A-1)" to "Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)"
- Development Permit for Hazard Lands (Steep Slopes and Flood Prone) and Sensitive Ecosystems (Streamside Areas and Green Infrastructure Areas)
- Development Variance Permit to:
  (a) Reduce minimum Type II - Interior lot width from 13.4m to 12.5m for Lot 10
  (b) Reduce minimum Type II - Interior lot depth from 24m to 22m for Lots 6-7, 9-10, 13-14
  (c) Allow front access, side-by-side double garage on a lot less than 13.4m wide in RF-13 Zone for Lot 10
- Council endorsed public notification to proceed for Bylaw No. 21166 and authorized staff to draft the Development Permit and approve the Development Variance Permit.
